name: Residence Inn Arlington Capital View

reviews.text: Stayed with my Two kids. Hotel is very clean and well set up. Staff are very friendly and helpful with tips. The breakfast and dinners are actually pretty good. Be sure to get there early. It is always packed. Only gripe was the charge for parking.
reviews.title: Very Solid Hotel with Great Staff

reviews.text: (Head & shoulders above even the best Residence Inns (RI); an additional star is needed.)
reviews.title: Superb Suites • Healthy Breakfasts • Full Dinners • Free, 10-Min. Shuttle to DCA • Brief Metro Ride to DC, Smithsonian

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New, upscale, 14-story RI -- over 300 suites – walking distance to numerous Crystal City restaurants & shops. (For walk/ drive times & distances, see below.)
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Pricey Parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: • Comfortable, spacious, quiet, 1-bedroom suite with all RI amenities. New, clean, modern décor & furnishings -- even crisp, fresh linens.
reviews.title: Brand new, needs a little work

reviews.text: • Two modern computers & printer in seated area (behind gatehouse sitting area) to print documents & boarding passes.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: I always stay in Crystal City when visiting DC because of the great hotel rates here on the weekend. This Residence Inn, together with the Renaissance next door (same building), are the two newest hotels in this area (opened 2011.) The great reviews here are accurate and I would stay here without hesitation, especially for a longer stay, when you can take full advantage of the complete kitchen, free breakfast and weekday dinners.
reviews.title: GREAT MARRIOTT ADDITION TO CRYSTAL CITY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Great hotel and friendly staff

reviews.text: --clean, modern, functional rooms with full kitchen, free wired or wireless HSIA, room safe.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: --large TV channel line-up with HD programming
reviews.title: I love this hotel because obit's staff.If you want to try, say hi to Ms. Grace!

reviews.text: --free shuttle service to DCA and CC Metro every 20 mins till 11pm
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for business trip this past week and found it to be one of the best I have been in awhile. The breakfast and manager's reception were excellent. The food was great and nice that they offer a complimentary meal at the reception which allowed me to save money during my stay. I appreciated the free airport shuttle and the shuttle to the metro. The free wireless internet access as well as the free computer access with printer was great to have. I was able to print my boarding pass at the hotel. The rooms were very comfortable and nice. I would stay there again anytime I am in the area. I have always found Residence Inn hotels great. The staff were very friendly and always willing to help anyone out when needed.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel

reviews.text: Earlier this month, my wife, daughter and granddaughter stayed at this beautiful hotel with the intention of picking up our other son and daughter who were flying into Reagan National. Living 4 hours from DC, we did not want to make a one day trip and therefore decided to stay overnight on Friday as their scheduled landing was at 9 AM on Saturday.
reviews.title: Flight Delay Makes For An Extended Stay

reviews.text: Upon checkin, we were greeted by a friendly desk associate who put us in a suite facing the airport. I love plane spotting, so this was perfect for me. As most travelers know, Reagan has one of the most interesting approaches in the country. The room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. We took advantage of the unique pool. The pool and workout facility is shared with the adjoining Renaissance Hotel. Early Saturday morning, my daughter called to let us know that thay had missed their flight from Omaha, and that the next flight would be the following day, Sunday.
reviews.title: One of the best!

reviews.text: I rushed down to attemp to extend our stay by one more day, and the desk associate was so kind to allow us to stay in our suite another day at the same price that we had origionally reserved. What a relief. Our extra day afforded us the opportunity to visit the National Archives, which my wife had wanted to visit her entire lifetime.
reviews.title: A Great Choice

reviews.text: We enjoyed a delicious breakfast both mornings. The staff was friendly and accomadating. We did make one request from housekeeping for an extra blanket for our daughter and granddaughter (I like the temperature to remain cool in the room) to which they proptly responded. We ordered room service on Saturday night, which was brout up hot and delicious from the Renaissance on site Resturant. I discovered that Potomac Avenue offers direct, almost traffic-less access to a shopping center about 2 miles south of the hotel. If you have ever stayed in Crystal City, you know this is a real plus when you need to pick up a few things from the grocer or Target.
reviews.title: Great hotel with great service!

reviews.text: Fairly modern, clean and quiet - a good night's rest. Staff seemed a bit more pleasant than normally found at business hotels - in a genuine way, as if they enjoyed woking there. Breakfast buffet of good quality & variety. Excellent fitness center (shared with adjacent Renaissance), much better than average and something that makes a big difference for me. Shuttles to the Metro & airport operate every 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay - Will Use Again

reviews.text: This place is great. Friendly employees, great service and location. Easy to the metro and city, and easier to the airport. Will certainly be back and would stay here for work or pleasure. While it was nice to have it be mostly adults, this property would be good if you were traveling with children too.
reviews.title: Second time a charm

reviews.text: Large room, efficient kitchen.
reviews.title: Choose the Residence, not the Renaissance

reviews.text: The Residence and Renaissance are side by side in this location. We were dropped off at the Renaissance by mistake by the van from the airport. The lobby is very fancy and futuristic. I wondered whether I had chosen wrong by going with the Residence, and not the Renaissance. That evening, while I was wandering, I inadvertently got into the Renaissance 'side' (through the gym that they share). The elevator took forever to arrive. It was jam packed, and when I got to the 7th floor, which was my floor in the Residence, the carpet was shabby, and I could hear partying from the elevator foyer.
reviews.title: Feels second rate... Best Western quality, Marriott price

reviews.text: I was really happy to retrace my steps back to my room on the Residence 'side'. Although the lobby is not ostentatious, my floor (7th) was clean and well cared for, and quiet. The wait for the elevator was minimal.
reviews.title: nice location and service

aka: Residence Inn Arlington Capital View Hotel
